intro: Teucrium, commonly known as germander, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. It consists of approximately 250 species, many of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants typically have square stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. They are often found in meadows, woodlands, and rocky soils. Some species of Teucrium are used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.
